intro: Cardamine berteroana, commonly known as the Bertero's watercress, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves that are often submerged or floating in aquatic environments. The plant produces white or pale yellow flowers with four petals, typical of the mustard family. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including regions of India and China. Cardamine berteroana is often found in marshy areas and along the edges of slow-moving streams.
